data.name: AboutIf
data.value: Checks if any one of the specified conditions are met and returns the corresponding value. If none of the conditions are met, the function returns the specified default value.

data.name: IfArgCond
data.value: logical_test
data.comment: function_parameter - First parameter for the If function, the condition that will be evaluated. Translate this string. Maintain as a single word (do not add spaces).

data.name: IfArgTrueValue
data.value: true_value
data.comment: function_parameter - Second parameter for the If function, an expression which will be evaluated if the first parameter is true. Translate this string. Maintain as a single word (do not add spaces).

data.name: IfArgElseValue
data.value: else_value
data.comment: function_parameter - Third parameter for the If function, an expression which will be evaluated if the first parameter is false. Translate this string. Maintain as a single word (do not add spaces).

data.name: AboutIf_logical_test
data.value: A condition that results in a boolean value.

data.name: AboutIf_true_value
data.value: An expression that provides the result of If when the condition is true.

data.name: AboutIf_else_value
data.value: An expression that provides the result of If when all specified conditions are false.

data.name: AboutSwitch
data.value: Matches the result of a formula with a series of values. When a match is found, a corresponding formula is evaluated and returned. If no matches are found, the last default formula is evaluated and returned.

data.name: SwitchExpression
data.value: switch_value
data.comment: function_parameter - First parameter for the Switch function, the value to compare against each 'match_value' parameter passed to the function. Translate this string. Maintain as a single word (do not add spaces).

data.name: SwitchDefaultReturn
data.value: default_result
data.comment: function_parameter - Last optional parameter for the Switch function, formula evaluated and returned when there is no match found. Translate this string. Maintain as a single word (do not add spaces).

data.name: SwitchCaseExpr
data.value: match_value
data.comment: function_parameter - match_value parameter for the Switch function, the value that will be matched with switch_value. Translate this string. Maintain as a single word (do not add spaces).

data.name: SwitchCaseArg
data.value: match_result
data.comment: function_parameter - result statement to return when match is found. Translate this string. Maintain as a single word (do not add spaces).

data.name: AboutSwitch_switch_value
data.value: Value to compare against each match_value.
data.comment: The term 'match_value' should be translated the same way as the resource with the key 'SwitchCaseExpr'

data.name: AboutSwitch_match_value
data.value: Value to match with switch_value.
data.comment: The term 'switch_value' should be translated the same way as the resource with the key 'SwitchExpression'

data.name: AboutSwitch_match_result
data.value: Formula to evaluate and return if match is found.

data.name: AboutSwitch_default_result
data.value: Formula to evaluate and return if no matches are found.

data.comment: function_parameter - First parameter for the Remove function. The data source that contains the records that you want to remove from. Translate this string. When translating, maintain as a single word (i.e., do not add spaces).

data.name: RemoveRecordsArg
data.value: remove_record(s)
data.comment: function_parameter - One or more records to be removed. Translate this string. When translating, maintain as a single word (i.e., do not add spaces).

data.name: ErrRemoveAllArg
data.value: If provided, last argument must be 'RemoveFlags.All'. Is there a typo?
data.comment: {Locked=RemoveFlags.All} Error Message, RemoveFlags.All is an enum value that does not get localized.

data.name: NotificationType_Error_DisplayName
data.value: Error
data.comment: Display text representing the Error value of NotificationType enum (NotificationType_Error_Name). This describes showing an error notification. The possible values for this enumeration are: Error, Warning, Success, Information.

data.name: NotificationType_Warning_DisplayName
data.value: Warning
data.comment: Display text representing the Warning value of NotificationType enum (NotificationType_Warning_Name). This describes showing an warning notification. The possible values for this enumeration are: Error, Warning, Success, Information.

data.name: NotificationType_Success_DisplayName
data.value: Success
data.comment: Display text representing the Error value of NotificationType enum (NotificationType_Success_Name). This describes showing an success notification. The possible values for this enumeration are: Error, Warning, Success, Information.

data.name: NotificationType_Information_DisplayName
data.value: Information
data.comment: Display text representing the Error value of NotificationType enum (NotificationType_Information_Name). This describes showing an information notification. The possible values for this enumeration are: Error, Warning, Success, Information.

data.name: AboutIsError
data.value: Returns whether an error occurred when evaluating the given argument.

data.name: IsErrorArg
data.value: value
data.comment: function_parameter - First argument to the IsError function - any value, to check if there was an error in producing it.

data.name: AboutIsError_value
data.value: The value to check for errors.
data.comment: Description of the first parameter to IsError

data.name: ErrBadArityMinimum
data.value: Invalid number of arguments: received {0}, expected {1} or more.
data.comment: Error Message. {0} Will be a number, and {1} will be a number, the minimum number of arguments.

data.name: ErrBadArityRange
data.value: Invalid number of arguments: received {0}, expected {1}-{2}.
data.comment: Error Message. {0} Will be a number, and {1} will be the minimum arity and {2} will be the maximum arity

data.name: ErrGeneralError
data.comment: Error message. {0} will be replaced with the contents of the message. In a few specific instances, we pull error messages from a source other than this file, but we need a error key in this file to attach it to, hence why we have an error message that is only a format specifier.

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrOperandExpected_ShortMessage
data.value: Expected an operand. The formula or expression expects a valid operand. For example, you can add the operand '2' to the expression ' 1 +_' so that the result is '3'. Or, you can add the operand "there" to the expression '"Hi "& _ ' so that the result is 'Hi there'.

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrOperandExpected_HowToFix_1
data.value: Supply an operand value that will complete the expression. Ensure that the operand's type (text, number, date, or true/false) fits the expression. Match numbers with numbers, text with text, and so on. For example, '1 + "Hi"' isn't valid, but '1 + 2' is valid.

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrBadToken_ShortMessage
data.value: Unexpected characters. Characters are used in the formula in an unexpected way.

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrBadToken_LongMessage
data.value: For example, the character '\' isn't expected after a number, like this: '32\'. A space ('32') would be expected so that it's just the number 32, or another number (as in '323') would be expected.

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrBadToken_HowToFix_1
data.value: Remove or replace the unexpected characters.

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrBadToken_Link_1
data.value: Article: Formula reference for Power Apps
data.comment: Article: Formula reference for Power Apps

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrBadToken_Link_1_URL
data.value: https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2132478

data.name: ErrorResource_UnexpectedCharacterToken_ShortMessage
data.value: Unexpected character '{0}' at position '{1}' in the formula.

data.name: ErrorResource_UnexpectedCharacterToken_LongMessage
data.value: For example, the character '\' isn't expected after a number, like this: '32\'. A space ('32') would be expected so that it's just the number 32, or another number (as in '323') would be expected.

data.name: ErrorResource_UnexpectedCharacterToken_HowToFix_1
data.value: Remove or replace the unexpected character.

data.name: ErrorResource_UnexpectedCharacterToken_Link_1
data.value: Article: Formula reference for Power Apps
data.comment: Article: Formula reference for Power Apps

data.name: ErrorResource_UnexpectedCharacterToken_Link_1_URL
data.value: https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2132478

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrMissingEndOfBlockComment_ShortMessage
data.value: Missing end-comment identifier. The block comment has no end-comment identifier.

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrMissingEndOfBlockComment_LongMessage
data.value: Each block comment must start with '/*' and end with '*/'. If you don't end each block comment properly, all code after the comment becomes part of that comment. If a comment comprises only one line, you can start it with '//' and not identify the end of the comment.

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrMissingEndOfBlockComment_HowToFix_1
data.value: Add '*/' to the end of your block comment, or change it to a set of line comments.

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrMissingEndOfBlockComment_Link_1
data.value: Article: Formula reference for Power Apps
data.comment: Article: Formula reference for Power Apps

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrMissingEndOfBlockComment_Link_1_URL
data.value: https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2132478

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrExpectedFound_Ex_Fnd_ShortMessage
data.value: Unexpected characters. The formula contains '{0}' where '{1}' is expected.

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrExpectedFound_Ex_Fnd_LongMessage
data.value: This error occurs if, for example, a formula contains '{{Val@ 7}}' instead of '{{Val: 7}}'. When you set a variable, the syntax requires a colon instead of an "at" symbol.

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrExpectedFound_Ex_Fnd_HowToFix_1
data.value: Remove or replace the unexpected characters with an expected character.

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrExpectedFound_Ex_Fnd_Link_1
data.value: Article: Formula reference for Power Apps
data.comment: Article: Formula reference for Power Apps

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrExpectedFound_Ex_Fnd_Link_1_URL
data.value: https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2132478

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrInvalidName_ShortMessage
data.value: Name isn't valid. '{0}' isn't recognized.

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrInvalidName_LongMessage
data.value: This error appears most commonly when a formula refers to something that no longer exists (for example, a control that you've deleted).

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrInvalidName_HowToFix_1
data.value: Remove or correct the reference to the name that isn't valid.

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrInvalidName_Link_1
data.value: Article: Formula reference for Power Apps
data.comment: Article: Formula reference for Power Apps

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrInvalidName_Link_1_URL
data.value: https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2132478

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrInvalidIdentifier_ShortMessage
data.value: Name isn't valid. This identifier isn't recognized.

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrInvalidIdentifier_LongMessage
data.value: This error appears most commonly when a formula refers to something that no longer exists (for example, a control that you've deleted).

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrInvalidIdentifier_HowToFix_1
data.value: Remove or correct the reference to the name that isn't valid.

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrInvalidIdentifier_Link_1
data.value: Article: Formula reference for Power Apps
data.comment: Article: Formula reference for Power Apps

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrInvalidIdentifier_Link_1_URL
data.value: https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2132478

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrInvalidPropertyReference_ShortMessage
data.value: Property reference isn't valid.

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrInvalidPropertyReference_LongMessage
data.value: This error appears when a formula refers to component function properties with invalid syntax. (For example, Component.CustomFunction instead of Component.CustomFunction())

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrInvalidPropertyReference_HowToFix_1
data.value: Use correct syntax to refer to component function property. For example, Component.CustomFunction()

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrInvalidPropertyReference_Link_1
data.value: Article: Formula reference for PowerApps

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrInvalidPropertyReference_Link_1_URL
data.value: https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2132478

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrInvalidParentUse_ShortMessage
data.value: 'Parent' reference isn't valid. You can't reference a parent control in this context.

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrInvalidParentUse_LongMessage
data.value: You can't use the Parent operator with a control that doesn't have a parent control. This operator refers to the control that hosts the given control and makes all of its properties available.

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrInvalidParentUse_HowToFix_1
data.value: Remove the 'Parent' operator.

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrInvalidParentUse_Link_1
data.value: Article: Add and configure a canvas-app control in Power Apps
data.comment: Article on UI design - working with controls

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrInvalidParentUse_Link_1_URL
data.value: https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2119116

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrTooManyUps_ShortMessage
data.value: Row-scope nesting too deep. Your formula's row scope exceeds 63 nesting levels.

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrTooManyUps_LongMessage
data.value: Complexity increases with each nesting level, so Power Apps supports row-scope nesting only up to 63 levels.

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrTooManyUps_HowToFix_1
data.value: Rewrite the formula with fewer nesting levels.

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrRuleNestedTooDeeply_ShortMessage
data.value: Expression nesting too deep. An expression in your formula is nested more than 50 levels.

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrRuleNestedTooDeeply_LongMessage
data.value: Power Apps supports expression nesting up to only 50 levels. An expression this deep is difficult to understand and maintain.

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrRuleNestedTooDeeply_HowToFix_1
data.value: Rewrite the formula with fewer nesting levels.

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrOperatorExpected_ShortMessage
data.value: Expected operator. We expect an operator such as +, *, or & at this point in the formula.

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrOperatorExpected_LongMessage
data.value: Operators join two operands together. This error occurs if you put two functions (operands) together with no operator between them -- for example, Len("mytext")Len("mytext").

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrOperatorExpected_HowToFix_1
data.value: Edit your formula so that it includes an operator between the operands.

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrOperatorExpected_Link_1
data.value: Module: Use basic formulas

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrOperatorExpected_Link_1_URL
data.value: https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2132396

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrNumberExpected_ShortMessage
data.value: Expected number. We expect a number at this point in the formula.

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrNumberExpected_LongMessage
data.value: This error will occur if you use a function that requires a number but you supply, for example, an image instead.

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrNumberExpected_HowToFix_1
data.value: Edit your formula so that it evaluates to a number at this point in the formula.

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrNumberExpected_Link_1
data.value: Article: Formula reference for Power Apps
data.comment: Article: Formula reference for Power Apps

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrNumberExpected_Link_1_URL
data.value: https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2132478

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrBooleanExpected_ShortMessage
data.value: Expected boolean. We expect a boolean (true/false) at this point in the formula.

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrBooleanExpected_LongMessage
data.value: A boolean is also known as a true/false value in applications such as Microsoft Excel. This error will occur if you use a function that requires a boolean but you supply, for example, a date instead.

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrBooleanExpected_HowToFix_1
data.value: Edit your formula so that it evaluates to a boolean at this point in the formula.

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrBooleanExpected_Link_1
data.value: Article: Formula reference for Power Apps
data.comment: Article: Formula reference for Power Apps

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrBooleanExpected_Link_1_URL
data.value: https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2132478

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrColonExpected_ShortMessage
data.value: Expected colon. We expect a colon (:) at this point in the formula.

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrColonExpected_LongMessage
data.value: A colon separates a field name, sometimes called a column name, from a field value in a record (for example, {Month:"1"}, {Month:"2"} …). A colon also separates hours from minutes and seconds (for example, "3:04").

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrColonExpected_HowToFix_1
data.value: Edit your formula so that it includes a colon.

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrColonExpected_Link_1
data.value: Article: Show text, dates, and times in Power Apps
data.comment: Article: Show text, dates, and times

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrColonExpected_Link_1_URL
data.value: https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2132645

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrBehaviorPropertyExpected_ShortMessage
data.value: Behavior function in a non-behavior property. You can't use this property to change values elsewhere in the app.

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrBehaviorPropertyExpected_LongMessage
data.value: Behavior functions change the state of the app by changing values elsewhere in the app. 'Navigate', 'Patch', 'UpdateContext', and 'Collect' are common behavior functions. 'OnSelect', 'OnVisible', and other 'On …' properties are common behavior-based properties.

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrBehaviorPropertyExpected_HowToFix_1
data.value: Move the behavior function to a behavior-based property.

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrBehaviorPropertyExpected_Link_1
data.value: Article: Understand behavior formulas for canvas apps in Power Apps

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrBehaviorPropertyExpected_Link_1_URL
data.value: https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2132570

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrTestPropertyExpected_ShortMessage
data.value: Test function in a non-test property. You can't use this property to invoke test-only functions.
data.comment: Error Message. The term 'Test' is an adjective ('Test function' = 'function for testing').

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrTestPropertyExpected_LongMessage
data.value: Test functions are those that can be used to simulate user input when testing an app. 'SetProperty', 'SelectRow', and 'Assert' are common test functions. They can only be used in the in test cases.

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrTestPropertyExpected_HowToFix_1
data.value: Use the function in a test case, not in the app itself.

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrCannotCoerce_SourceType_TargetType_ShortMessage
data.value: Can't convert this data type. Power Apps can't convert this {0} to a {1}.

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrCannotCoerce_SourceType_TargetType_LongMessage
data.value: Power Apps can convert some types of data in your formula to other types for you. For example, it can convert "1" (a string) to a 1 (a number), but it can't all data types to all other data type. For example, it can't convert an image to a number.

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrCannotCoerce_SourceType_TargetType_HowToFix_1
data.value: Edit your formula so that you convert the data in question to the expected type.

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrStringExpected_ShortMessage
data.value: Expected text. We expect text at this point in the formula.

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrStringExpected_LongMessage
data.value: This error occurs if you use a function that requires a text (or string) argument and you supply, for example, a date instead.

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrStringExpected_HowToFix_1
data.value: Edit your formula so that it evaluates to text at this point in the formula.

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrStringExpected_Link_1
data.value: Article: Formula reference for Power Apps
data.comment: Article: Formula reference for Power Apps

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrStringExpected_Link_1_URL
data.value: https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2132478

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrNumberOrStringExpected_ShortMessage
data.value: Expected text or number. We expect text or a number at this point in the formula.

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrNumberOrStringExpected_LongMessage
data.value: This error will occur if you use a function that requires either text or a number but you supply, for example, a boolean (true/false) value.

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrNumberOrStringExpected_HowToFix_1
data.value: Edit your formula so that it evaluates to text or a number at this point in the formula.

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrNumberOrStringExpected_Link_1
data.value: Article: Formula reference for Power Apps
data.comment: Article: Formula reference for Power Apps

data.value: https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2132478

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrClosingBracketExpected_ShortMessage
data.value: Expected closing bracket. We expect a closing bracket (}) at this point in the formula.

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrClosingBracketExpected_LongMessage
data.value: A closing bracket indicates the end of a record (for example, {Month:"1"}, {Month:"2"} …).

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrClosingBracketExpected_HowToFix_1
data.value: Edit your formula so that it includes a bracket.

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrEmptyInvalidIdentifier_ShortMessage
data.value: The identifier has no valid text.

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrEmptyInvalidIdentifier_HowToFix_1
data.value: Ensure you have text for your identifier. This error occurs when the identifier is all blanks or spaces.

data.name: ErrUnOrderedTypeForComparison_Type
data.value: Unable to compare values of type {0}.
data.comment: Error message when the user attempts to compare (using Less Than, Greater Than, Less Than or Equal, Greater Than or Equal) values of non-numeric types. {0} will be canonical type representations like "Number" or "Boolean".

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrIncompatibleTypesForEquality_Left_Right_ShortMessage
data.value: Incompatible types for comparison. These types can't be compared: {0}, {1}.
data.comment: Error message when the user attempts to check equality between two values that don't make sense together. {0} and {1} will be canonical type representations like "Number" or "Boolean".

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrIncompatibleTypesForEquality_Left_Right_LongMessage
data.value: We can't evaluate your formula because the values being compared in the formula aren’t the same type.

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrIncompatibleTypesForEquality_Left_Right_HowToFix_1
data.value: You might need to convert the value to be the same type, such as converting a date string (e.g., "12/31/2018") to a date value.

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrIncompatibleTypesForEquality_Left_Right_HowToFix_2
data.value: If you’re comparing records or tables, the field or column types must match exactly.

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrIncompatibleTypesForEquality_Left_Right_Link_1
data.value: Module: Use basic formulas

data.name: ErrorResource_ErrIncompatibleTypesForEquality_Left_Right_Link_1_URL

data.name: ErrorResource_SuggestRemoteExecutionHint_ShortMessage
data.value: Delegation warning. The "{0}" part of this formula might not work correctly on large data sets.

data.name: ErrorResource_SuggestRemoteExecutionHint_LongMessage
data.value: The data source might not be able to process the formula and might return an incomplete data set. Your application might not return correct results or behave correctly if the data set is incomplete.

data.name: ErrorResource_SuggestRemoteExecutionHint_HowToFix_1
data.value: If your data set exceeds the 500 record limit but contains less than 2,000 records, try resetting the limit.

data.name: ErrorResource_SuggestRemoteExecutionHint_HowToFix_2
data.value: Try simplifying the formula.

data.name: ErrorResource_SuggestRemoteExecutionHint_HowToFix_3

data.name: ErrorResource_SuggestRemoteExecutionHint_InOpRhs_ShortMessage
data.value: Delegation warning. The highlighted part of this formula might not work correctly on large data sets.

data.name: ErrorResource_SuggestRemoteExecutionHint_InOpRhs_LongMessage
data.value: The right side of the "in" operator should be a column name from the correct data source. The data source might not be able to process the formula and might return an incomplete data set. Your application might not return correct results or behave correctly if the data set is incomplete.

data.name: ErrUDF_MissingReturnType
data.value: Missing function return type, for example the ":Number" in "FindMonth( d:Text ):Number = Month( DateParse( d ));"
data.comment: This error message shows up when return type is not provided for user defined function, the term FindMonth is a function name, and if translated it should remain a single word {Locked=Number} {Locked=Text} {Locked=Month} {Locked=DateParse}

data.name: ErrUDF_MissingParamType
data.value: Missing function argument type, for example the ":Text" in "FindMonth( d:Text ):Number = Month( DateParse( d ))"
data.comment: This error message shows up when argument type is not provided for the parameters in user defined function, the term FindMonth is a function name, and if translated it should remain a single word {Locked=Number} {Locked=Text} {Locked=Month} {Locked=DateParse}

data.name: InfoRegExCaptureNameHidesPredefinedFullMatchField
data.value: The capture name '{0}' is hiding the predefined property that returns the full match of the regular expression. Consider renaming it if you want to use that named property to extract the full match in the specified text.

data.name: InfoRegExCaptureNameHidesPredefinedSubMatchesField

data.name: InfoRegExCaptureNameHidesPredefinedStartMatchField

data.name: ErrFunctionArg2ParamMustBeConstant
data.value: The '{1}' parameter to the {0} function must be a constant value.
data.comment: Error message shown to the user if they use a non-constant value for the a function that requires a constant value. The first parameter is the function name, and the second parameter is the function parameter name.

data.name: ErrJSONArg2IncompatibleOptions
data.value: The JSONFormat values '{0}' and '{1}' cannot be used together.
data.comment: {Locked=JSONFormat} Error message shown to the user if they try to use incompatible values from the JSONFormat enumeration. The parameters are string values, members of that enumeration. For example: The JSONFormat values 'IgnoreBinaryData' and 'IncludeBinaryData' cannot be used together.

data.name: ErrJSONArg2UnsupportedOption
data.value: The value '{0}' is not supported as an option in the JSON function.
data.comment: {Locked=JSON} Error message shown to the user if they try to pass an option that is not supported to the JSON function. The parameter is a single-character string value. For example: The value '$' is not supported as an option in the JSON function.

data.name: ErrJSONArg1ContainsUnsupportedMedia
data.value: The value passed to the JSON function contains media, and it is not supported by default. To allow JSON serialization of media values, make sure to use the IncludeBinaryData option in the 'format' parameter.
data.comment: {Locked=JSON}{Locked=IncludeBinaryData}. Error message shown to the user if they try to serialize an object that contains media values, without specifying the flag that would allow that operation to happen. Media values are any form of media (audio, images, video) that are included as part of a record or a table. The term 'format' should be translated like the term 'JSONArg2' in this same file.

data.name: ErrJSONArg1UnsupportedType
data.value: The JSON function cannot serialize objects of type '{0}'.
data.comment: {Locked=JSON}. Error message shown to the user if they try to serialize an object which is not supported in the JSON function.

data.name: ErrJSONArg1UnsupportedNestedType
data.value: The JSON function cannot serialize tables / objects with a nested property called '{0}' of type '{1}'.
data.comment: {Locked=JSON}. Error message shown to the user if they try to serialize an object which contain a nested property of a type which is not supported in the JSON function. Both parameters are strings. E.g.: The JSON function cannot serialize tables / objects with a nested property called 'value' of type 'Polymorphic'.

data.name: ErrJSONArg1UnsupportedTypeWithNonBehavioral
data.value: The JSON function cannot serialize binary data in non-behavioral expression.

data.name: ErrTraceInvalidCustomRecordType
data.value: The parameter {0} contains a property of type {1} which is not supported.
data.comment: Error shown to the user when they try to use a custom record with an unsupported type. The first argument is the name of the parameter, the second argument is the type name.

data.name: ErrRecordContainsInvalidFields_Arg

data.name: ErrDeprecatedDotUseShowColumns

data.name: IntellisenseAiDisclaimer
data.value: **Disclaimer:** AI-generated content can have mistakes. Make sure it's accurate and appropriate before using it. [See terms](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2225491)
data.comment: The disclaimer we show on AI functions. This is github flavored markdown. So ** marks text in bold.

data.name: AboutUniChar
data.value: Returns the Unicode character that is referenced by the given numeric value.

data.name: AboutUniChar_number
data.value: Numeric value to be converted into a Unicode character.

data.name: UniCharArg1
data.value: number
data.comment: function_parameter - First argument to the UniChar function - numberic value to be converted into a Unicode character.

data.name: AboutUniCharT
data.value: Converts a table of numeric values to a table of Unicode characters.

data.name: UniCharTArg1
data.value: column_of_numbers
data.comment: function_parameter - First argument to the UniChar function - a table column of numeric values to be converted into Unicode characters. Translate this string. When translating, maintain as a single word (i.e., do not add spaces).

data.name: AboutUniChar_column_of_numbers
data.value: A table column of numeric values to be converted into Unicode characters.

data.name: ErrOnlyPartialAttribute
data.value: Unsupported attribute kind
data.comment: Error message when the user attempted to use the attribute syntax on a named formula definition, but we didn't recognize the attribute name they specified.

data.name: ErrOperationDoesntMatch
data.value: All Partial operators on matching named formulas must be the same.
data.comment: {Locked=Partial} Error message when the user attempted to use a partial operator on multiple named formulas, but didn't specify the same operator on each one. A partial operator is the 2nd part of a statement `[Partial Op]` and can be one of "And", "Or", "Table" or "Record". It's used to determine how to combine multiple expressions with the same name and operator.

data.name: ErrUnknownPartialOp
data.value: Unknown Partial operator.
data.comment: {Locked=Partial}. Error message when the user attempted to use a Partial operator that we don't recognize. A partial operator is the 2nd part of a statement `[Partial Op]` and can be one of "And", "Or", "Table" or "Record". It's used to determine how to combine multiple expressions with the same name and operator.

data.name: ErrTruncatedArgWarning
data.value: Delegation warning. The result of this argument '{0}' may be truncated for large data sets before being passed to the '{1}' function.
data.comment: Error message when an argument to non-delegable function has possible delegation and resulting rows may be truncated

data.name: ErrNeedPrimitive
data.value: Expected a text, numeric, boolean, or date/time value.

data.name: ErrSummarizeNoGroupBy
data.value: Summarize requires at least one grouping column.

data.name: ErrSummarizeInvalidArg
data.value: Summarize arguments must be either existing column names to group by or formulas named with the As keyword.

data.name: ErrSummarizeDatasourceAsNode
data.value: Summarize data source doesn't support As keyword.

data.name: ErrSummarizeThisGroupColumnName
data.value: Column 'ThisGroup' conflicts with a reserved name. Use 'RenameColumns' function to pick a different name.

data.name: ErrSummarizeDataSourceContainsThisGroupColumn
data.value: The datasource contains a column named 'ThisGroup', which conflicts with a reserved name. Use 'RenameColumns' function to pick a different name.

data.name: ErrSummarizeDataSourceScopeNotSupported
data.value: Scoping the data source (usage of 'As' keyword) is not supported.
